diffusion of knowledge and technological innovations. However, these are hampered by various

The literature on how, in a systemic way, the barriers to sustainability transition can be overcome in
various circumstances has been growing rapidly over the past de
cades. A central element is that national
systems of innovation can help achieving both climate change and sustainable development goals, by
integrating new ideas, devices, resources, new and traditional knowledge and technological changes for
as a process that can bring value
by means of creating more effective products, services, processes,
technologies, policies and business models that are applicable to commercial, business, financial and
The literature refers to the terms “technology push,” “market pull,” “regulatory push
specific factors” as drivers for innovation, mostly to inform policymakers
n growing interest in social drivers, motivated by the recognition of social issues,
such as unemployment and public health, linked to the deployment of innovative low
. Policy and social factors and the diverse tra
innovation are influenced by regional and national conditions
and purposes need to be considered in crafting international policies aimed at fostering the global
actor systemic innovation approach would be needed to enhance global
, especially if this is to lead to overall sustainability
improvements rather than resulting in new sustainability challenges.
